main event: Multiple observers reported seeing a round reddish-orange object hovering in the eastern sky on February 25, 1967.
interesting points: The object was described as being larger than a balloon with a flare attached,The sighting was supported by various accounts from different locations,Many observers noted the object emitted no sound and had no visible structure,Some witnesses reported the object fluctuated in brightness and was initially seen as a single ball of light,The local radio station received numerous calls regarding the sighting and some suggested it resembled a balloon with a flare.
witness description: University students and residents near the University of Illinois campus
